page.title: 04ST MARY'S CHURCH, NEWICK
page.content: Newick's Parish Church of St.Mary dates from Norman times. The oldest part is the South wall, where there is a Norman window. The porch dates from about 1400 and the tower was built in the early 15th century. The 13th century chancel was extended about 1880. The Parish Registers go back to 1558 and the rectors are known from 1288. St.Mary's is a beautiful old church, surrounded by a churchyard full of interesting tombstones, some dating from the 17th century. The Old Rectory, with its Queen Anne origins, is no longer used by the rectors of Newick, it being too large and expensive to run. A project has been started to purchase an old barn and turn it into a Centre for Christianity in Newick.
